org.mxupdate.update.util
Enum UpdateException_mxJPO.Error

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Enum<UpdateException_mxJPO.Error>
      org.mxupdate.update.util.UpdateException_mxJPO.Error
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<UpdateException_mxJPO.Error>
Enclosing class:
UpdateException_mxJPO
public static enum UpdateException_mxJPO.Error
extends Enum<UpdateException_mxJPO.Error>

Enumeration for all known update errors. The codes itself are "speaking" numbers.

For classes implementing specific exports / updates for an administration object, following algorithm is used:

  • the first digit defines data model (1), program (2), user (3) or user interface (4)
  • depending of the first digit, the second and third digit defines the kind of configuration item
    • 106: dimension
  • the fourth and fifth digit defines the error itself

Exceptions from utility classes (package org.mxupdate.update.util) starts with 90. The next digit defines the class where the exception is thrown:

  • 1: AbstractParser_mxJPO
  • 2: AdminProperty_mxJPO
  • 3: JPOCaller_mxJPO
  • 4: MqlUtil_mxJPO
  • 5: ParameterCache_mxJPO
  • 6: StringUtil_mxJPO

Example:
10601: 1 for data model, 06 for dimension, 01 for the error

Enum Constant Summary
DIMENSION_UPDATE_DEFAULTUNIT
          The default unit of a dimension is tried to update which means that potentially some data could be loosed.
DIMENSION_UPDATE_MULTIPLIER
          The multiplier of a unit of a dimension is tried to update which means that potentially some data could be loosed.
DIMENSION_UPDATE_OFFSET
          The offset of a unit of a dimension is tried to update which means that potentially some data could be loosed.
DIMENSION_UPDATE_REMOVEUNIT
          An unit of a dimension is tried to remove which means that potentially some data could be loosed.
DM_INTERFACE_UPDATE_REMOVING_PARENT
          An interface is already derived from another interface, but within the update this derived interface must be removed.
DM_INTERFACE_UPDATE_UKNOWN_PARAMETER
          A wrong parameter was given the the called TCL procedure testParents which defines the derived interfaces.
DM_INTERFACE_UPDATE_WRONG_NAME
          The name of the interface which calls the TCL procedure testParents and which is defined within the call as parameter is not equal.
UTIL_STRINGUTIL_CONVERT_FROM_FILENAME
          If the name of a configuration item could not be extracted from a file name.

The multiplier of a unit of a dimension is tried to update which means that potentially some data could be loosed.

The offset of a unit of a dimension is tried to update which means that potentially some data could be loosed.

See Also:
Dimension_mxJPO

DIMENSION_UPDATE_DEFAULTUNIT

public static final UpdateException_mxJPO.Error DIMENSION_UPDATE_DEFAULTUNIT
The default unit of a dimension is tried to update which means that potentially some data could be loosed. FYI: MX itself also tries to prevent this if a default unit is already defined, but it could be that this case does only happens e.g. in non development systems....

See Also:
Dimension_mxJPO

DIMENSION_UPDATE_REMOVEUNIT

public static final UpdateException_mxJPO.Error DIMENSION_UPDATE_REMOVEUNIT
An unit of a dimension is tried to remove which means that potentially some data could be loosed. FYI: MX itself also tries to prevent this if a unit is used, but it could be that this case does only happens e.g. in non development systems....

See Also:
Dimension_mxJPO

DM_INTERFACE_UPDATE_UKNOWN_PARAMETER

public static final UpdateException_mxJPO.Error DM_INTERFACE_UPDATE_UKNOWN_PARAMETER

A wrong parameter was given the the called TCL procedure testParents which defines the derived interfaces.

Parameters:

  1. wrong parameter

See Also:
Interface_mxJPO

DM_INTERFACE_UPDATE_WRONG_NAME

public static final UpdateException_mxJPO.Error DM_INTERFACE_UPDATE_WRONG_NAME

The name of the interface which calls the TCL procedure testParents and which is defined within the call as parameter is not equal.

Parameters:

  1. administration type (should be interface)
  2. name of the interface which calls the TCL update procedure
  3. name of the interface which is defined as parameter for the TCL update procedure

See Also:
Interface_mxJPO

DM_INTERFACE_UPDATE_REMOVING_PARENT

public static final UpdateException_mxJPO.Error DM_INTERFACE_UPDATE_REMOVING_PARENT

An interface is already derived from another interface, but within the update this derived interface must be removed. This could end in potentially losing data and so this action is not allowed.

Parameters:

  1. administration type (should be interface)
  2. interface which is tried to update
  3. current derived interface which must be removed (but is not allowed)

See Also:
Interface_mxJPO

UTIL_STRINGUTIL_CONVERT_FROM_FILENAME

public static final UpdateException_mxJPO.Error UTIL_STRINGUTIL_CONVERT_FROM_FILENAME
If the name of a configuration item could not be extracted from a file name.

See Also:
StringUtil_mxJPO.convertFromFileName(String)
